name: Chain
comment:
The chain of the given request.

A chain is composed of a target and 0 or more interceptors, and it can be directly manipulated only by interceptors.

done.name: done
done.comment: Get a bloodless/dart-async.Future that will complete when this Chain has completed.

error.name: error
error.comment: The error object thrown by the target

interrupted.name: interrupted
interrupted.comment: Returns true if this chain was interrupted

next.name: next
next.comment:
Call the next element of this chain (an interceptor or a target)

The given bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.next.callback will be executed when all following elements in the chain are completed. The callback can return a bloodless/dart-async.Future.

interrupt.name: interrupt
interrupt.comment: Interrupt this chain and closes the current request.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of bloodless/bloodless_server.Chain.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
